intro: Croton panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian croton, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
